sen.j: 八幡山（はちまんやま）は、毎年7月17日に京都市内で行われる祇園祭にて巡行する「山鉾」のひとつ。
sen.e: Hachimanyama is one of "yamahoko" floats, or decorative floats, which are paraded through streets during the Gion Festival held in Kyoto on the seventeenth of July.

sen.j: 全32の山鉾のうち、例年27番目に巡行している曳山。
sen.e: Of a total of thirty-two yamahoko floats, Hachimanyama is the hikiyama (a festival float) that comes in the twenty-seventh in the parade every year.

sen.j: 八幡山の御神体は応神天皇騎馬像で、運慶の作と云われる騎馬像に金箔を施し、お山の小祠に祀っている
sen.e: The goshintai (object of worship housed in a Shinto shrine and believed to contain the spirit of a deity) of Hachimanyama is the Statue of Horse-riding Emperor Ojin, which is an equestrian statue said to be a work by Unkei, done in gold lacquering and enshrined in the shoshi (small shrine) which is placed on the float.
